threads.title: Impressions of Money and why this excellent filler still makes the world go round.

posts.author: toucana

posts.author: Eldard
posts.body: Good review!  We've been playing Money for 25 years and it remains one of our favorite auction games.

posts.body: Great review of a classic card game!  Money has always been popular with our game groups. I have a copies from 1999 and I must say that the new artwork is fantastic!  I'm considering getting this late

posts.author: Boardgameswithb7
posts.body: Hey Bill, thank you for reading! I'm not surprised, it's such a super fun game! I love the new artwork as well, it really does pop! Thank you so much for joining! ğŸ˜º

An intriguing game.  Good start to the series.

posts.author: Palpatine
posts.body: Good review! BTW 50+40+30 is 120...not 110!

posts.author: DangerMouse
posts.body: Nice tie!  And speaking of ties, doesn't the *lowest* serial number break ties?

posts.author: Jacqats
posts.body: It was great! Best of luck with the launch today

posts.author: tippy7gnome
posts.body: Since I game mostly solo, I have a rule if I buy a game with no solo mode, it has to be still fun to play two-handed. Does Gartenbau fit this? It's so beautiful, but I wanted to check on this.

posts.author: fisherheaton
posts.body: I would imagine it will play well two-handed but we haven't tested it that way much.  The expansion content will include a solo mode.  Stay tuned for that

posts.author: lizmari
posts.body: fisherheaton wrote:I would imagine it will play well two-handed but we haven't tested it that way much.  The expansion content will include a solo mode.  Stay tuned for thatAny update on the expansion

posts.author: jjohnst13
posts.body: Was there any discussion about possible Solo Mode during the Kickstarter campaign?

posts.author: ratpack
posts.body: There is no solo mode at this time for the initial game release.

posts.author: cbourne
posts.body: I backed this game because I love the theme, art, and tiles, but I only ever game solo so hoping someone comes up with a variant soon.

posts.author: Ronaldo
posts.body: Thanks for the review. We absolutely love this gem. My son is an excellent CCG player and we have played Wizard Cup numerous times with all sorts of strategies and combos. Most of our series go to the

posts.author: Nekonyancer
posts.body: If you want to learn Wizards Cup, but you don't like reading rulebooks or watching videos, you might consider playing through the tutorial I wrote, which uses the BGA engine to take you step-by-step t

threads.title: Is there much strategy to this game?

posts.author: nemerleb
posts.body: Or is randomness the main component of the matches?

posts.author: Rontuaru
posts.body: It's more metagaming than anything else. Winning the contest of double-think between rounds is the "strategy".

posts.author: nemerleb
posts.body: I didn't know what 'metagaming' was. After research it seems to be like a mindplay between players.So I guess this game isn't really my type of thing.Thanks so much for answering.
